options.text: Mission Landing Zone is a prescriptive reference architecture with reference implementation of a SCCA compliant Hub and Spoke virtual network provided by Microsoft.
Mission Landing Zone is configured for deployment into a single subscription or many subscriptions depending on your needs for resource counts, subscription boundaries, or billing.
All network traffic is directed through the Azure Firewall residing in the Hub Virtual Network and houses the Azure Bastion host for secure remote access into the network.

options.text: Mission Landing Zone deploys virtual networks configured for SCCA compliance.

SCCA guidance and architectures are specific to DoD customers, but they also help civilian customers comply with Trusted Internet Connections (TIC) guidance and help commercial customers that want to implement a secure DMZ to protect their Azure environments.
Make sure that the address spaces do not overlap with each other for the Hub, Identity, Operations, or Shared Services networks.

options.text: To support the on-going security and compliance of your landing zone, MLZ provides options for configuring: Defender for Cloud, Regulatory Compliance Policies, and Microsoft Sentinel.

link.label: Click here to learn more about recommended security best practices

elements.name: defenderFreeSection
elements.label: Defender for Cloud - Cloud Security Posture Management

options.text: To support the on-going security and compliance of your landing zone, by default - MLZ deploys the free cloud security posture management features of Defender for Cloud, such as: secure score, which is powered by the Microsoft Cloud Security Benchmark. The Microsoft Cloud Security Benchmark is a security framework derived from Microsoft best practices, and NIST/CIS security Controls.

link.label: Click here to learn more about Defender for Cloud

elements.name: defenderSection
elements.label: Defender for Cloud - Workload Protection Plans and other advanced management features

options.text: For further enhanced protection, MLZ has the option of activiating the paid features of Defender for Cloud, such as: Defender Cloud Security Posture Management (DCSPM) and workload protection plans for additional threat protection for resources, such as: servers, storage, and more.

Enabling the additional paid features of Microsoft Defender for Cloud is recommended.  If you have previously enabled any paid workload protection plans, you must select the checkbox and relevant plans on the dropdown list, to ensure protection is maintained through any deployment(s) of MLZ.

elements.name: deployDefender
elements.label: Enable additional features for Microsoft Defender for Cloud?
elements.toolTip: Check here to enable additional paid features of Microsoft Defender for Cloud.

options.text: Click the link to open a new browser tab, to confirm what workload protection features are available in the in Azure Commercial and Azure Government Clouds.

elements.label: Defender for Cloud Additional Features
elements.toolTip: Check feature availability of paid Defender for Cloud features
elements.defaultDescription: Select paid Defender for Cloud features.

allowedValues.label: Defender CSPM
allowedValues.description: Provides enhanced posture management tools, such as: attack paths, cloud security explorer, and governance

allowedValues.label: Defender for Servers
allowedValues.description: Provide server protections through Microsoft Defender for Endpoint or extended protection with just-in-time network access, file integrity monitoring, vulnerability assessment, and more.

allowedValues.label: Defender for API
allowedValues.description: Safeguards APIs throughout their lifecycle, offering detection, response coverage, and vulnerability prioritization

allowedValues.label: Defender for App Services
allowedValues.description: Diagnose weaknesses in your application infrastructure that can leave your environment susceptible to attack.

allowedValues.label: Defender for Resource Manager
allowedValues.description: Protects against suspicious Azure Resource Mnagement operations, use of exploitation toolkits, and lateral movement.

allowedValues.label: Defender for Azure Cosmos DB
allowedValues.description: detects potential SQL injections, known bad actors based on Microsoft Threat Intelligence, suspicious access patterns, and potential exploitation of your database through compromised identities, or malicious insiders.

allowedValues.label: Defender for Key Vault
allowedValues.description: Detects unusual and potentially harmful attempts to access or exploit Key Vault accounts. This layer of protection helps you address threats even if you're not a security expert, and without the need to manage third-party security monitoring systems.

allowedValues.label: Defender for open-source relational databases
allowedValues.description: Provide alerts when it detects anomalous database access and query patterns as well as suspicious database activities

allowedValues.label: Defender for SQL Server on machines
allowedValues.description: Identify and mitigate potential database vulnerabilities and detecting anomalous activities that could indicate threats to your databases.

allowedValues.label: Defender for Azure SQL
allowedValues.description: Provides vulnerability assessment and threat protection for Azure SQL.

allowedValues.label: Defender for Storage
allowedValues.description: Detect unusual and potentially harmful attempts to access or exploit your storage accounts using: advanced threat detection capabilities and Microsoft Threat Intelligence data to provide contextual security alerts.

allowedValues.label: Defender for Containers
allowedValues.description: Provides security posture management, vulnerability assessment, run-time threat protection, and deployment-montioring for containers.

options.text: To assist with security compliance, MLZ can deploy additional regulatory compliance frameworks, powered by Azure Policy, to your landing zone.
Enabling policies is optional, but recommended if your organization must follow certain standards.

elements.name: deployPolicy
elements.label: Create policy assignments?
elements.toolTip: Check here to assign regulatory compliance policy assignments for the Mission Landing Zone.

elements.name: policy
elements.label: Policy Assignment
elements.toolTip: DoD IL5 is only available in AzureUsGovernment and will switch to NISTRev4 if tried in AzureCloud.
elements.defaultDescription: Select one of the bundled built-in policy assignments.

allowedValues.label: NIST SP 800-53 Rev4
allowedValues.description: The US National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) publishes a catalog of security and privacy controls, Special Publication (SP) 800-53, for all federal information systems in the United States (except those related to national security).

allowedValues.label: NIST SP 800-53 Rev5
allowedValues.description: The US National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) publishes a catalog of security and privacy controls, Special Publication (SP) 800-53, for all federal information systems in the United States (except those related to national security).

allowedValues.label: DoD IL5
allowedValues.description: The Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) is an agency of the US Department of Defense (DoD) that is responsible for developing and maintaining the DoD Cloud Computing Security Requirements Guide (SRG). These policies are only available for AzureUsGovernment and will switch to NISTRev4 if tried in AzureCloud.

allowedValues.label: CMMC
allowedValues.description: The Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC) is a new framework developed by the US Department of Defense (DoD) that requires formal third-party audits of defense industrial base (DIB) contractor cybersecurity practices.

options.text: Please validate the desired policy initiative exists in the target cloud before deployment, as there can be differences between clouds.
MLZ can deploy Microsoft Sentinel to the Log Analytics Workspace, for its Security information and event management (SIEM) and Security orchestration, automation, and response (SOAR).
Please note further configuration of Sentinel is required to take advantage of threat detection, log retention and response capabilities.
